metadata.name: bridge
metadata.description: Super awesome n1 bridging and state settlement contract

accounts.name: app_owner
docs: NOTE: Must check that the owner matches up.

accounts.name: app
docs: During initialization, we already set the space and rent to match
up to `App`, but wrote in `AppConfig`.`

accounts.name: crumb_authority
docs: Need a PDA to ensure that only this contract is allowed to
call this instruction; the contract storage account is
chosen since pretty much every other ix uses it, so this
avoids having to introduce a new account.

accounts.name: program
docs: Marked as signer to avoid races. This key should be thrown away after initialization.

accounts.name: asset_config
docs: New asset config PDA account to be created
This account is owned by the bridge program and stores the asset configuration

errors.name: AppConfigInvalid
errors.msg: app is invalid or already approved

errors.name: AppFrozen
errors.msg: app is frozen

errors.name: MinDepositInvalid
errors.msg: Min deposit must be greater than 0

errors.name: GlobalOwnerInvalid
errors.msg: provided global owner does not match configured global owner

errors.name: AppOwnerInvalid
errors.msg: app owner account does not match configured app's app_owner field

errors.name: OperatorInvalid
errors.msg: Operator account does not match configured app operator

errors.name: PermissionsInsufficient
errors.msg: signer does not have sufficient acl permissions

errors.name: NotAValidator
errors.msg: Ix was not signed with a registered validator account

errors.name: WithdrawalRateLimitExceeded
errors.msg: Total withdrawals in the last period exceeded the rate limit

errors.name: BlockEmpty
errors.msg: Block does not contain a state transition

errors.name: BlockNotFinalized
errors.msg: Block must be finalized before this operation

errors.name: BlockAlreadyFinalized
errors.msg: Block already finalized

errors.name: BlockAlreadyChallenged
errors.msg: Block already challenged by this validator

errors.name: BlockIsFinaTip
errors.msg: Cannot prune current finalized block tip

errors.name: BlockTooRecent
errors.msg: Block is not old enough to be pruned

errors.name: BlockHasUnexecutedEffects
errors.msg: Blocks effects have not all been executed

errors.name: RefundAccountInvalid
errors.msg: Refund account does not match the one stored in the block.

errors.name: BlockNotPruned
errors.msg: Block hasn't yet been pruned

errors.name: ChildBlocksInvalid
errors.msg: ChildBlocks account does not exist or is invalid

errors.name: ChildBlocksNoFinaCandidates
errors.msg: ChildBlocks account contains no finalizable candidates

errors.name: AppVersionNotAllowed
errors.msg: App version of block is not whitelisted for proposals or finalizations

errors.name: AppVersionsTooMany
errors.msg: App already at max allowed app versions capacity

types.name: App
docs: The central state of an app instance.
# Multitenancy
The bridge contract is multitenant. There may be multiple independent
[`App`] instances owned by a single bridge program.
Accounts owned by an app *instance* are PDAs "namespaced"  by including
the [`App`] address in their seeds.

fields.name: frozen
docs: Freeze all non-owner operations on this app

fields.name: operator
docs: Authority allowed to make proposals.

fields.name: challenge_consensus_threshold
docs: Number of challenges required to disqualify a block from finalization.
For consensus fraud proof on proposed blocks.
Value of 0 means every block becomes unfinalizable, halting withdrawals
indefinitely.
Value greater than validator set size means *any* block can be finalized
immediately even if challenged, defeating the fraud-proof mechanism.

fields.name: challenge_period_slots
docs: Initial number of slots during which a block can be challenged
Value of 0 means challenge window closes in the same slot; honest
validators cannot react, enabling malicious block finalization.
Value very large means blocks remain "Proposed" for years, preventing
finalization and liquidity exit (economic DoS).

fields.name: last_block_id
docs: Last block id that was proposed. Highest valid block id.
Blocks created and this counter bumped exclusively on proposal.
NOTE: this *could* be instead a separate counter per ChildBlocks account but
this global counter makes it a little easier to track the timeline of
when blocks where proposed.

fields.name: last_event_index
docs: Last event index that was made. Highest valid event index.
Deposits created and this counter bumped exclusively on deposit.

fields.name: fina_state_facts_prev_cmtmt
docs: `prev_state_facts.hash()` of the latest finalized block.
Used to find the ChildBlocks layer holding the latest finalized block.

fields.name: fina_state_facts
docs: Recent-most finalized state facts.
This corresponds to the next_state_facts of the last finalized block.

fields.name: target_fina_state_facts
docs: If set, only blocks working towards these state facts will be
finalizable. Once the target reached, this is unset.
If set to a statefacts in the past or impossible to "work towards",
the app will not accept any finalizations.
Can be manually set to None by the owner to remove the restriction.

fields.name: block_lifetime
docs: Block retention policy.
Blocks where slot_proposed + block_lifetime < slot_current  are prunable.

fields.name: allowed_app_versions
docs: Allowed app versions for new proposals and finalizations.
We only need to allow up to 2 versions concurrently in a typical upgrade
scenario: one for the state translation and one for the new app version.
We allow up to ALLOWED_APP_VERSIONS_LEN_MAX > 2 for some extra
maneuverability in case it is needed.

types.name: BlockFacts
docs: State transition block facts.

fields.name: refund_account
docs: Who to refund the rent of this nullifier to.
